page.title: 01Coulsdon and Purley
page.content: Coulsdon and Purley are two small adjacent towns just south of Croydon and situated on the northern edge of the North Downs with an excellent train service to London and the South Coast. Coulsdon is near the new M25 London Orbital Motorway and traffic is very heavy. Purley is positioned where the roads from Brighton and Eastbourne meet. It is a very busy road junction. As the volume of traffic has increased the roads have been widened, creating segregated shopping areas. Both Coulsdon and Purley are mainly residential with a wide range of houses ranging from those with half an acre of land in parts of Purley to more modest semi-detached houses and flats. There are large areas of open space, used chiefly as golf courses.
